meanings.definition: Climb awkwardly or with difficulty, using both hands and feet.
meanings.sent1: The little kitten tried to clamber up the tall tree.
meanings.sent2: I had to clamber over the fence to get to the other side.
meanings.sent3: The penguin decided to clamber onto the slippery ice, but kept sliding back down.
meanings.sent4: She had to clamber through the narrow tunnel of obstacles to reach the treasure at the end.
meanings.sent5: The exhausted hiker had to clamber up the steep mountain, grasping onto rocks for support.

meanings.definition: Climb, move, or get in or out of something in an awkward and laborious way.
meanings.sent1: The toddler tried to clamber onto the big chair but kept slipping off.
meanings.sent2: The explorer had to clamber out of the deep cave with great effort.
meanings.sent3: The clown attempted to clamber into the tiny car, but his big shoes got stuck.
meanings.sent4: She had to clamber through the crowded subway station during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The injured bird managed to clamber out of the trap, despite its broken wing.
